com.samsung.android.sdk.professionalaudio
Class Sapa

java.lang.Object
  com.samsung.android.sdk.professionalaudio.Sapa

public final class Sapa
extends java.lang.Object

Samsung Android Professional Audio

This class is the entry class that provides access to the Professional Audio package.
This class provides methods for initializing the Professional Audio package and for checking which Professional Audio features are supported.
The Professional Audio package provides support for the low latency audio and MIDI connection framework.

Since:
Samsung Android JellyBean
Version:
1.0
Author:
HaeSeok Oh, LaeHyuk Bang, JeongYeon Kim, DaeBeom Park

initialize

public void initialize(Context context)
                throws SsdkUnsupportedException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Initialize an instance of the Professional Audio package.
If Professional Audio is not supported, an SsdkUnsupportedException exception is thrown.

Parameters:
context - The Context for your application.
Throws:
SsdkUnsupportedException - Thrown if the Professional Audio package is not supported.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the Context passed is not valid.

isFeatureEnabled

public boolean isFeatureEnabled(int type)
Check if the specified Professional Audio feature is available on the device.
Before calling this method, call Sapa.initialize() to initialize the Professional Audio package.

Parameters:
type - The Professional Audio feature.
The valid values are:
SUPPORT_LOW_LATENCY
SUPPORT_MID_LATENCY
SUPPORT_HIGH_LATENCY
SUPPORT_CAPTURE_DEVICE
SUPPORT_DUMMY
SUPPORT_PLAYBACK_DEVICE,
SUPPORT_BOOST_MODE
SUPPORT_SAMPLERATE_48000
SUPPORT_SAMPLERATE_44100
Returns:
true - if the specified Professional Audio feature is available on the device.
false - if the specified Professional Audio feature is not available on the device.
